text: Putnam County is the least extensive county in the U.S. state of Illinois. According to the 2020 census, it had a population of 5,637. The county seat is Hennepin. The county was founded in 1825 and named after Israel Putnam, who was a general in the American Revolution. == References == Category:1825 establishments in Illinois Category:Illinois counties
title: Putnam County, Illinois
